text: Clyde is an unincorporated area in Indiana County, in the U.S. state of Pennsylvania. ==History== A post office called Clyde was established in 1882, and remained in operation until 1955. The origin of the name Clyde is obscure; it may be named after the River Clyde in Scotland. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Indiana County, Pennsylvania Category:Unincorporated communities in Pennsylvania
title: Clyde, Pennsylvania
